definition: to grasp/to hold/to operate/to manage/to control/to steer/to exercise/to drill (practice)/to play/to speak (a language)
to do/to manage/to handle/to go about/to run/to set up/to deal with

sentences.english: An auspicious day; referring to the date of a wedding.
sentences.chinese: 今天是不容错过的吉期，适于操办婚事。

sentences.english: Today is an unmissable auspicious day, suitable for holding a wedding.
sentences.chinese: 今天是不容错过的吉期，适于操办婚事。

sentences.english: It is the first time a private company has run the ice festival.
sentences.chinese: 这是首次由私人公司操办冰灯节。

sentences.english: The Green's spared no efforts on their daughter's wedding reception.
sentences.chinese: 格林夫妇不予余力地操办女儿的婚事。

sentences.english: Force 670,000 event people, this is a good time.
sentences.chinese: 力操办大事的人来说，这是一个好时机。

sentences.english: Marriage is different in a number of ways in my country.
sentences.chinese: 操办婚事在我的祖国有很多做法都是跟美国不同的。

sentences.english: In China, the wedding is generally hosted by the groom's family.
sentences.chinese: 在中国，婚礼一般都是由男家来操办。

sentences.english: I've run conferences before which do do this and that's fine but this was a volunteer event.
sentences.chinese: 我已经操办了一些会议，但是这次是一个志愿项目。

sentences.english: And I had the wonderful experience last summer of working on my daughter’s wedding.
sentences.chinese: 去年夏天操办女儿的婚礼时，我非常开心。

sentences.english: They also took part in a 1Malaysia wedding reception organised by the Federal Territory Islamic Affairs Department (Jawi).
sentences.chinese: 并且参加了联邦伊斯兰事务部为他们操办的婚宴。

definition: to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
to entertain (for dinner)/to invite to dinner
to do/to manage/to handle/to go about/to run/to set up/to deal with
to celebrate a birthday (of an elderly person)
to decide/to make decisions/to take responsibility (for deciding)/to be in charge/to give sb justice
to provide (items for an event)/to cater/to make preparations
to send the betrothal gifts/(fig.) to conclude a marriage
